channel.title: Need HD help
channel.description:
Could anyone here help me fix this error i get in my cmd? java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/sun/gluegen/runtime/DynamicLookupHelper
I get it when I try and start high-definition on DKK's client. I have the gluegen-rt, gluegen, clientlibs, com, and jogl libraries in my lib folder. What is going wrong? I understand it can't find the class, I'm assumnig gluegen doesnt have it... any help?
EDIT: The libs are integrated into the run.bat and compiler. So I'm very unsure what is wrong. [code]@echo off "C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jdk1.7.0_02/bin\javac.exe" -cp lib/gluegen-rt.jar;lib/gluegen.jar;lib/jogl.jar;lib/clientlibs.jar;lib/com.jar; -d bin src/*.java @pause[/code] [code]@echo off "C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jre7/bin/java.exe" -cp bin;lib/gluegen.jar;lib/gluegen-rt.jar;lib/jogl.jar;lib/com.jar;lib/clientlibs.jar; client 0 live english game0 -cp lib/*; -cp jagex3/*; -cp JavaApplication3/*; -cp netscape/*; pause [/code]

item.title: Need HD help
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:

[quote=“Lubelube, post:7, topic:425854”]Hmm, still doesnt seem to work![/quote]you will need to find that jar online then like the main page where you download to use it and replace it.

item.title: Need HD help
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

My Computer->C:->Program Files->Java->jre6(or 7)->bin->javacpl
Clear anything and EVERYTHING.

Now, to be safe, empty recycle bin/and reboot pc.
Try to compile again. Some how the jar is corrupted I think

Read full topic

item.title: Need HD help
item.dc:creator: @Lubelube Lubelube
item.description:
@Lubelube wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:4, topic:425854”][quote author=Lubelube link=topic=528530.msg3854613#msg3854613 date=1324255454]

are these directories in the compiler itself?

No they are not
[/quote]try adding the directories to the compiler :)[/quote]

@echo off "C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jdk1.7.0_02/bin\javac.exe" -cp lib/gluegen-rt.jar;lib/gluegen.jar;lib/jogl.jar;lib/clientlibs.jar;lib/com.jar; -d bin src/*.java @pause

Like that right? Cause it still has same error :\

EDIT: The libs are also integrated into the run.bat too

[code]@echo off
“C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jre7/bin/java.exe” -cp bin;lib/gluegen.jar;lib/gluegen-rt.jar;lib/jogl.jar;lib/com.jar;lib/clientlibs.jar; client 0 live english game0 -cp lib/; -cp jagex3/; -cp JavaApplication3/; -cp netscape/;
pause

[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Need HD help
item.dc:creator: @Lubelube Lubelube
item.description:
@Lubelube wrote:

Could anyone here help me fix this error i get in my cmd?
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/sun/gluegen/runtime/DynamicLookupHelper

I get it when I try and start high-definition on DKK’s client.
I have the gluegen-rt, gluegen, clientlibs, com, and jogl libraries in my lib folder.
What is going wrong? I understand it can’t find the class, I’m assumnig gluegen doesnt have it… any help?

EDIT: The libs are integrated into the run.bat and compiler. So I’m very unsure what is wrong.

@echo off "C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jdk1.7.0_02/bin\javac.exe" -cp lib/gluegen-rt.jar;lib/gluegen.jar;lib/jogl.jar;lib/clientlibs.jar;lib/com.jar; -d bin src/*.java @pause

@echo off "C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jre7/bin/java.exe" -cp bin;lib/gluegen.jar;lib/gluegen-rt.jar;lib/jogl.jar;lib/com.jar;lib/clientlibs.jar; client 0 live english game0 -cp lib/*; -cp jagex3/*; -cp JavaApplication3/*; -cp netscape/*; pause
